intro: Bobua liukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu bobua, is a species of flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands in Japan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
